    • Method Detail

      • isTouchDragInterval

        public boolean isTouchDragInterval()
        if touch drag interval is set, by using this check method, a range of drag can be detected

        EXAMPLE:
        touchDragIntervalRange is 100px, user puts finger on screen and drags his finger, after 100px dragging, this method will return true. This can be very handy for real swipe intentions. For example, user swipe down to get notification center, but you would not want to get notification center, for verly little swipe downs like 2, 3px

      • getDirectionIntent

        public InputIntent.DirectionIntent getDirectionIntent()
        Get drag intention

        TOUCH_IDLE, TOUCH_D_UP, TOUCH_D_DOWN, TOUCH_D_LEFT, TOUCH_D_RIGHT

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset everything. USE THIS: on touchUp methods

      • setTouchInitials

        public void setTouchInitials(float x,
                    float y)
        Set initial touches. USE THIS: on touchDown method

      • getTouchDragIntervalRange

        public float getTouchDragIntervalRange()
        Get tuch drag interval range

      • setTouchDragIntervalRange

        public void setTouchDragIntervalRange(float touchDragIntervalRange)
        if touch drag interval is set, by using this check method, a range of drag can be detected

        EXAMPLE:
        User swipe down to get notification center, but you would not want to get notification center, for very little swipe downs like 2, 3px. Set this as 100px, so by using isTouchDragInterval() method, you can confirm swipe down, after 100px.

      • setTouchDifferences

        public void setTouchDifferences()
        Set touch differences, optional, if you need amount of change from initial touch to drag, USE THIS: on touchDrag, pan or similar mthods

      • getTouchDifX

        public float getTouchDifX()
        Get touch difference on X-axis from initial point, if you change your drag direction without removing finger from screen, inital touch will be the point of direction change

      • setTouchDifX

        public void setTouchDifX(float touchDifX)
        Set touch diff X

      • getTouchDifY

        public float getTouchDifY()
        Get touch difference on Y-axis from initial point, if you change your drag direction without removing finger from screen, inital touch will be the point of direction change

      • setTouchDifY

        public void setTouchDifY(float touchDifY)
        Set touch diff Y
